xxl.core.io.converters
Class Converters

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converters

public class Converters
extends Object

This class contains various methods connected to the serialization of objects. The toByteArray methods return a serialized object as byte array and the sizeOf methods determine the length of a serialized object without materializing the bytes into the memory.

The documentation of the methods contained in this class includes a brief description of the implementation. Such descriptions should be regarded as implementation notes, rather than parts of the specification. Implementors should feel free to substitute other algorithms, as long as the specification itself is adhered to.

See Also:
ByteArrayOutputStream, DataOutputStream, IOException, OutputStream

Method Detail

getObjectConverter

public static <T> Converter<Object> getObjectConverter(Converter<T> converter)
Returns a converter that is able to read and write objects based on the given converter. Internally the returned converter casted the objects to be read or written to the type expected by the given converter. Therefore the returned converter will cause a ClasscastException when its methods are called with object that do not have the expected type.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the objects which can be read and written by the given converter.
Parameters:
converter - the converter that is used to read and write the objects internally.
Returns:
a converter that is able to read and write objects based on the given comparator.

getConverterForJavaType

public static Converter<Object> getConverterForJavaType(String javaTypeName)
Returns a converter which can convert a java type. Only the name of the java type has to be given. If there is no converter available then this method returns a ConvertableConverter (and hopes that the object to be converted is convertable).

Parameters:
javaTypeName - String which represents a java classname.
Returns:
the desired converter

toByteArray

public static <T> byte[] toByteArray(Converter<? super T> converter,
                                     T object)
Creates a newly allocated byte array that contains the serialization of the spezified object. Its size is the size of the serialized object as returned by sizeOf(converter, object). If the creation of the byte array fails (e.g., an IOException is thrown) this method returns null.

This implementation creates a new ByteArrayOutputStream that is wrapped by a new DataOutputStream. Thereafter the specified object is written to the DataOutputStream using its write method of the converter and the result of the ByteArrayOutputStream's toByteArray method is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object to be converted.
Parameters:
converter - the converter to be used for converting the object.
object - the object to be converted.
Returns:
the serialized state (attributes) of the specified object, as a byte array.

toByteArray

public static <T> byte[] toByteArray(SizeConverter<? super T> converter,
                                     T object)
Creates a newly allocated byte array that contains the serialization of the spezified object. Its size is the size of the serialized object as returned by sizeOf(converter, object). If the creation of the byte array fails (e.g., an IOException is thrown) this method returns null.

This implementation creates a new ByteArrayOutputStream that is wrapped by a new DataOutputStream. Thereafter the specified object is written to the DataOutputStream using its write method of the size converter and the result of the ByteArrayOutputStream's toByteArray method is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object to be converted.
Parameters:
converter - the size converter to be used for converting the object.
object - the object to be converted.
Returns:
the serialized state (attributes) of the specified object, as a byte array.

toByteArray

public static byte[] toByteArray(Convertable convertable)
Creates a newly allocated byte array that contains the serialization of the spezified convertable object. Its size is the size of the serialized object as returned by sizeOf(convertable). If the creation of the byte array fails (e.g., an IOException is thrown) this method returns null.

This implementation creates a new ByteArrayOutputStream that is wrapped by a new DataOutputStream. Thereafter the specified object is written to the DataOutputStream using its write method and the result of the ByteArrayOutputStream's toByteArray method is returned.

Parameters:
convertable - the convertable object to be converted.
Returns:
the serialized state (attributes) of the specified object, as a byte array.

sizeOf

public static <T> int sizeOf(Converter<? super T> converter,
                             T object)
Returns the number of bytes needed to serialize the state (the attributes) of the specified object. If the measuring fails this method should return -1.

This implementation creates an anonymous local class that implements the interface OutputStream. The write method of this local class only increases a counter and the hashCode method returns it. Thereafter the specified object is written to the OutputStream using the write method of the converter. If this call succeeds the hashCode of the OutputStream (the number of bytes written to the output stream) is returned otherwise -1 is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object to be converted.
Parameters:
converter - the converter to be used for converting the object.
object - the object to be converted.
Returns:
the number of bytes needed to serialize the state (the attributes) of the specified object or -1 if the measuring fails.

sizeOf

public static int sizeOf(Convertable convertable)
Returns the number of bytes needed to serialize the state (the attributes) of the specified convertable object. If the measuring fails this method should return -1.

This implementation creates an anonymous local class that implements the interface OutputStream. The write method of this local class only increases a counter and the hashCode method returns it. Thereafter the specified object is written to the OutputStream using its write method. If this call succeeds the hashCode of the OutputStream (the number of bytes written to the output stream) is returned otherwise -1 is returned.

Parameters:
convertable - the convertable object to be converted.
Returns:
the number of bytes needed to serialize the state (the attributes) of the specified object or -1 if the measuring fails.

readSingleObject

public static <T> T readSingleObject(File file,
                                     T object,
                                     Converter<T> converter)
                          throws IOException
Reads a single object from the given file and returns it. The specified converter is used for reading the object.

This implementation opens a new data input stream on the given file and uses the specified converter to read the desired object. The specified object is passed to the read method of the converter.

Note that every time this method is called, a new input stream is opened and closed on the given file. Therefore this method should not be used for continuous reading of objects.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object to be read.
Parameters:
file - the file from which to read the object.
object - the object to read. If (object==null) the converter should create a new object, else the specified object is filled with the read data.
converter - the converter used for reading the object.
Returns:
the object which was read.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeSingleObject

public static <T> void writeSingleObject(File file,
                                         T object,
                                         Converter<? super T> converter)
                              throws IOException
Writes a single object to the given file. The specified converter is used for writing the object.

This implementation opens a new data output stream on the given file and uses the specified converter to write the given object. The specified object is passed to the write method of the converter.

Note that every time this method is called, a new output stream is opened and closed on the given file. Therefore this method should not be used for continuous writing of objects.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object to be written.
Parameters:
file - the file to which to write the object.
object - the object to write.
converter - the converter used for writing the object.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

readSingleObject

public static Convertable readSingleObject(File file,
                                           Convertable object)
                                    throws IOException
Reads a single convertable object from the given file and returns it.

This implementation is equivalent to the call of readSingleObject(file, object, ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).

Note that every time this method is called, a new input stream is opened and closed on the given file. Therefore this method should not be used for continuous reading of objects.

Parameters:
file - the file from which to read the object.
object - the object to read. If (object==null) the converter should create a new object, else the specified object is filled with the read data.
Returns:
the object which was read.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeSingleObject

public static void writeSingleObject(File file,
                                     Convertable object)
                              throws IOException
Writes a single convertable object to the given file.

This implementation is equivalent to the call of writeSingleObject(file, object, ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).

Note that every time this method is called, a new output stream is opened and closed on the given file. Therefore this method should not be used for continuous writing of objects.

Parameters:
file - the file to which to write the object.
object - the object to write.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
